page.title: 05CATTLE MARKETS IN PERTH
page.content:
There are{two markets in Perth,} MacDonald, Fraser and Co. Ltd.and Hay and Co. { MacDonald and Fraser's,}which was founded in 1875, employs around 50 people and covers 3_4 acres. It is {famed for pedigree bull sales.}Other animals sold here are store and fat cattle and sheep. The store animals from all over Scotland are sold to farmers to fatten and sell again as fat stock. This fat stock is then sold to wholesale merchants from Glasgow and Edinburgh or to local butchers. Also sold in the market at various times in the year are pigs, rams, poultry and plants. If a farm goes out of business,the auctioneers can go out and sell the animals, buildings, machinery and land.
